content:
• Friday, October 21, 2011
  • DHR

    Danaher (NYSE:DHR) closed with a 3.6% gain after the conglomerate beat Q3 estimates, and used...

    Danaher (NYSE:DHR) closed with a 3.6% gain after the conglomerate beat Q3 estimates, and used its CC to lift its 2011 EPS guidance, to $2.79-$2.84. Barclays likes what it sees, believing the company's acquisition of test equipment maker Tektronix has been vindicated, and expecting Danaher to boost the margins of recent acquisition Beckman Coulter.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • SWSH

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH +6%) closes higher after the company says it's acquiring Gulf Coast...

    Swisher Hygiene (SWSH +6%) closes higher after the company says it's acquiring Gulf Coast Laundry Services of Mississippi - a linen services company that provides linen rental and laundry services throughout the southern delta region - for $4.8M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • SXT

    Sensient Technologies (NYSE:SXT), which calls itself  "the world's leading supplier of...

    Sensient Technologies (NYSE:SXT), which calls itself  "the world's leading supplier of flavors, fragrances and colors," closed with a fragrant 6.3% gain after posting Q3 results. Revenue of $363.8M (+7% Y/Y) missed by $8.7M, but EPS of $0.64 beat by $0.02, and the company lifted its 2011 EPS guidance to $2.38-$2.42, from a prior $2.32-$2.37.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • MFIN

    Medallion Financial (TAXI +5.1%), provider of financing for taxicab medallions in some major...

    Medallion Financial (TAXI +5.1%), provider of financing for taxicab medallions in some major U.S. cities, speeds to a three-year high on a NYT report that NYC taxi medallion prices hit a record $1M, up from $10 when first issued in 1937. Not a bad investment: The value of a medallion is up 1,900% since 1981.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • STX

    Seagate's (STX +28.2%) post-earnings rally continues, as analysts predict the crippling of...

    Seagate's (STX +28.2%) post-earnings rally continues, as analysts predict the crippling of Western Digital's (WDC -0.6%) Thai facilities will allow Seagate to gain hard drive share, and "turn back the clock" on pricing. However, Robert W. Baird cautions inventory issues could prove an offset, and that the effect of Thai flooding on the PC industry could be enormous. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • CLGX

    CoreLogic's (CLGX +5.1%) largest shareholder is concerned with the timing of its strategic...

    CoreLogic's (CLGX +5.1%) largest shareholder is concerned with the timing of its strategic review, and asks management to consider alternatives to selling the entire firm, according to an SEC filing. First American Financial (FAF +0.2%), which spun off CLGX in 2010 and remains its largest shareholder, suggests it sell certain non-core businesses, which it offers to purchase.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • TCO

    Luxury-mall owner Taubman Centers (TCO +3.7%) is trading higher after its Q3 beat across the...

    Luxury-mall owner Taubman Centers (TCO +3.7%) is trading higher after its Q3 beat across the board on stronger-than-expected revenue from higher rent and occupancy rates. The company also raises its FY11 guidance for funds from operations, now saying it expects to earn between $2.95 - $3.00 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK +8.6%) spikes following rumors it may be in talks with private equity firms...

    Eastman Kodak (EK +8.6%) spikes following rumors it may be in talks with private equity firms Silverpoint and Cerberus for as much as $900M in rescue financing. No official word has been released by the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • STI

    SunTrust (STI -3.8%) trades lower on the back of a mixed Q3 earnings report this morning....

    SunTrust (STI -3.8%) trades lower on the back of a mixed Q3 earnings report this morning. Despite beating estimates on a 41% jump in Y/Y profit, the quality of earnings disappointed with a decline in fee based income. Janney Capital notes that even with positive loan growth, the bank's net interest margin compression and other credit related costs are likely to impact over the near-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • SSI

    Shares of Stage Stores (NYSE:SSI) fall off 3.9% after SunTrust takes its rating down to Neutral...

    Shares of Stage Stores (NYSE:SSI) fall off 3.9% after SunTrust takes its rating down to Neutral rating from Buy. It has been a rocky patch for the retailer, missing three straight months on same-store sales vs. Thomson Reuter's estimate (I, II, III).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • FLIR

    FLIR Systems (FLIR -3.3%) trades lower after reporting mixed Q3 results yesterday and receiving...

    FLIR Systems (FLIR -3.3%) trades lower after reporting mixed Q3 results yesterday and receiving a downgrade this morning by Needham to Hold on valuation. The firm cites lower growth expectations for the company due to reductions in the DoD budget.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • APD

    Air Products (APD -1.1%) trades lower after its FQ4 misses estimates, despite an 11% jump in...

    Air Products (APD -1.1%) trades lower after its FQ4 misses estimates, despite an 11% jump in profits Y/Y on higher volume growth in Asia and double-digit gains in three out of four of its business units. The company lowers overall FY12 EPS guidance, now expecting to earn between $5.90 to $6.30 per share, below the Street consensus of $6.28.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • HON

    Defense contractors are outperforming in the wake of Honeywell's (HON +4.6%) strong Q3 report,...

    Defense contractors are outperforming in the wake of Honeywell's (HON +4.6%) strong Q3 report, which featured better-than-expected numbers from its Aerospace division. BA +2.7%. GD +2.8%. RTN +2.4%. NOC +2.6%. ATK +3.2%. (HON transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • PGI

    Premiere Global Services (NYSE:PGI), a provider of web-based conferencing services, gains 13.9%...

    Premiere Global Services (NYSE:PGI), a provider of web-based conferencing services, gains 13.9% after reporting Q3 revenue of $119.2M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.18, beating consensus by $4.3M and $0.01. The company expects 2011 revenue of $469M-$472M and EPS of $0.61-$0.62, compared with a consensus of $465.6M and $0.61.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • RRR-OLD

    Shares of RSR Holdings (RRR-OLD -8.9%) trail off sharply, even after the company beat EPS and...

    Shares of RSR Holdings (RRR-OLD -8.9%) trail off sharply, even after the company beat EPS and revenue estimates with its Q3 report. The company says it sees Q4 revenue growth in excess of 20% as more companies outsource equipment needs rather than commit to capital to buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • GILD

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -10.7%) shares plunge after Abbott Laboratories (ABT -0.6%) says interim...

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS -10.7%) shares plunge after Abbott Laboratories (ABT -0.6%) says interim results from a study of its rival experimental hepatitis C drug showed high cure rates. During an analyst meeting, Abbott says the results found that patients with the liver infection can be cured without adding interferon to treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • BIIB

    After trading lower premarket on an extended FDA review for its Tysabri drug, Biogen Idec...

    After trading lower premarket on an extended FDA review for its Tysabri drug, Biogen Idec (NASDAQ:BIIB) is up 5.3%, as investors choose to focus on positive trial data for the company's BG-12 drug for treating MS. Jefferies says it now has "increased confidence" BG-12 will be the leading front-line treatment for MS."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • AAL

    Noting American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) has no unencumbered assets left on its balance sheet,...

    Noting American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) has no unencumbered assets left on its balance sheet, Morningstar fails to see how the company can refinance $1B due in 2012 and $1B in 2013. Toss in a $560M required payment to the pension plan, coupled with losses from operating the business, and the firm's $4.3B stash starts to disappear quickly. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • IBKR

    The recent market-churning volatility was good for Interactive Brokers (IBKR +4.66%) in Q3, as...

    The recent market-churning volatility was good for Interactive Brokers (IBKR +4.66%) in Q3, as the company's profit more than doubled Y/Y. The company reported an EPS of $0.50 on net revenues of $386M, boosted by a 24% jump in market-making activity and 45% boost in commissions and execution fees.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • AAL

    American Airlines (AMR -8.3%) is plunging as comments hit from Morningstar: "We now believe that...

    American Airlines (AMR -8.3%) is plunging as comments hit from Morningstar: "We now believe that AMR will succumb to bankruptcy." The WSJ is also reporting investigators blame pilot lapses and mechanical problems for a Dec. 2010 incident where a plan skidded of the runway in Wyoming.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • RNST

    Renasant (RNST -4.4%) dips after Sterne Agee cut the shares to Underperform from Neutral earlier...

    Renasant (RNST -4.4%) dips after Sterne Agee cut the shares to Underperform from Neutral earlier today, citing the bank's slow progress in growing its loan portfolio and added pressure on credit quality.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • AAPL

    Perhaps still hungover from its rare earnings miss, Apple (AAPL -0.3%) gives up a nice early...

    Perhaps still hungover from its rare earnings miss, Apple (AAPL -0.3%) gives up a nice early gain and turns red in an otherwise powerful tape. The gorilla of the Nasdaq, it's dragged that index nearly 1% off of its highs, now +1% for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • COF

    Shares of Capital One (COF +6.5%) move higher after the firm beats estimates for Q3 EPS and...

    Shares of Capital One (COF +6.5%) move higher after the firm beats estimates for Q3 EPS and revenue with the uptick in net interest margin to 7.39% from 7.21% the headliner in the report. The company says in a CC today that it remains on track to complete the acquisition of ING Direct's (ING +0.9%) U.S. unit late in 2011 or early in 2012, and to complete the purchase of  HSBC's credit card business in Q2 of 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (PENN -3.7%) trades lower after Brean Murray cut the shares to Hold from...

    Penn National Gaming (PENN -3.7%) trades lower after Brean Murray cut the shares to Hold from Buy. The firm says weak EBITDA guidance for 2012 will likely limit near-term upside for the stock. Separately, Susquehana lowers its price target from $48 to $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM

  • Arabica coffee futures are up 5% on concerns heavy rain and flooding in Latin America and Asia...

    Arabica coffee futures are up 5% on concerns heavy rain and flooding in Latin America and Asia will choke off short-term supplies. Analysts see a tight supply continuing over the next year, putting upward pressure on prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • RTW

    Women's apparel chain New York & Co. (NWY -7.4%) trades lower after Janney downgrades the...

    Women's apparel chain New York & Co. (NWY -7.4%) trades lower after Janney downgrades the shares to Neutral, citing low inventory levels that may cap sales potential and a weakening economic backdrop. Janney also notes concern about company's product line, saying it continues to struggle with casual offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • INTC

    Altera (ALTR +12.1%) surges after investors decide its weak earnings and guidance are more about...

    Altera (ALTR +12.1%) surges after investors decide its weak earnings and guidance are more about inventory issues than customer demand, and is bringing rivals Xilinx (XLNX +2.8%), Lattice (LSCC +5%), and QuickLogic (QUIK +3.7%) along for the ride. Meanwhile, Sandisk's (SNDK +7.8%) results are lifting flash memory firms Micron (MU +3%) and Spansion (CODE +3.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SIVB

    SVB Financial Group (SIVB +12%) pops on much better-than-expected Q3 results, reporting an EPS...

    SVB Financial Group (SIVB +12%) pops on much better-than-expected Q3 results, reporting an EPS of $0.86 cents a share, far better than Street expectations of $0.77 cents a share. Gains in top line performance were driven by higher loan growth, +11% Y/Y, while its bottom line was propped up lower charge offs and an improvement in overall credit quality. (pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • CALX

    Calix (CALX -13.6%), which issued a warning in September, crashes towards its 52-week low after...

    Calix (CALX -13.6%), which issued a warning in September, crashes towards its 52-week low after reporting Q3 revenue of $83.7M (+11% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.07, missing consensus by $0.3M and $0.01. Jefferies remains bullish on the broadband infrastructure firm, naming stimulus spending and new products among its long-term catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • HOG

    Shares of Harley-Davidson (NYSE:HOG), up 5.3%, shrug off word that Goldman Sachs lowered its...

    Shares of Harley-Davidson (NYSE:HOG), up 5.3%, shrug off word that Goldman Sachs lowered its price target to $44, saying higher operating costs could hit earnings. Analysts with the firm now see EPS for FY11, FY12, and FY13 moving down to $2.28, $3.04, and $3.56, respectively. HOG now trades close to its pre-Q3 report level from earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • F

    Ford (F +4%) shares jump after S&P raises its credit rating on the automaker to BB+ from BB-...

    Ford (F +4%) shares jump after S&P raises its credit rating on the automaker to BB+ from BB- with a stable outlook, based on its view that "Ford's prospects for generating free cash flow, and profits in its automotive manufacturing business remain intact, because of its cost base in North America." Also: GM +4.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • DRQ

    Dril-Quip (DRQ +5.5%) gains after announcing its Chairman and CEO J. Mike Walker has retired,...

    Dril-Quip (DRQ +5.5%) gains after announcing its Chairman and CEO J. Mike Walker has retired, and names company veterans John Lovoi to the position of chairman and Blake DeBerry as chief executive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • FLEX

    Shares of Flextronics (FLEX +7.8%) move higher after beating estimates for Q2 revenue. Looking...

    Shares of Flextronics (FLEX +7.8%) move higher after beating estimates for Q2 revenue. Looking forward, the company says it expects Q3 revenue to fall in a range of $7.3B-$7.7B - which includes $550M of accelerated revenue from its exit out of the ODM PC business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • EZPW

    Pawnshop operator Ezcorp (EZPW -4.8%) takes a hit after Sterne Agee cut the shares to...

    Pawnshop operator Ezcorp (EZPW -4.8%) takes a hit after Sterne Agee cut the shares to Underperform, citing concerns over FY12 guidance and issues of management. The company has lost focus, Sterne Agee says, and it needs to restore confidence that it's looking after shareholder interests.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) tack on a 6% gain following its stellar Q3 report. Motley Fool's...

    Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) tack on a 6% gain following its stellar Q3 report. Motley Fool's Rick Aristotle Munarriz suggests the company may be playing it conservative with its low single-digit comparable store sales estimate, reminding that the company offered the same projection for FY11 before delivering its 11.3% mark.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • XXIA

    Ixia (XXIA +9.3%), a maker of network testing gear, shoots higher after reporting Q3 revenue of...

    Ixia (XXIA +9.3%), a maker of network testing gear, shoots higher after reporting Q3 revenue of $77.3M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16, beating Street forecasts by $0.8M and $0.04. In spite of widespread fears of telecom capex cuts, the company says "key market indicators and customer spending trends are encouraging."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics (SYNA +18.4%) shares sizzle after a strong quarter prompts at least three Street...

    Synaptics (SYNA +18.4%) shares sizzle after a strong quarter prompts at least three Street analysts to raise their ratings on the provider of touchpads. Windows 8 could offer big opportunities: "SYNA is well-positioned given its solid relationship with notebook vendors and the fact that it is currently the only qualified supplier for both the touchscreen and touchpad portion."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • AOS

    A.O. Smith (AOS +3.9%) rises after reporting Q3 earnings of $0.58 vs. $0.48 expected. After...

    A.O. Smith (AOS +3.9%) rises after reporting Q3 earnings of $0.58 vs. $0.48 expected. After stripping out a one-time gain from an asset sale, earnings were just $0.39. Of particular interest is a comment on the conference call noting a deceleration in hot water heater sales in China: "The main place we're seeing weakness is the very large cities."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • FSL

    Freescale Semiconductor (FSL -6%) tanks following its Q3 report. While revenue of $1.14B (-7%...

    Freescale Semiconductor (FSL -6%) tanks following its Q3 report. While revenue of $1.14B (-7% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.29 beat by $12M and $0.06, the company guided on its call for Q4 revenue of $1B-$1.06B, below a $1.11B consensus. Like fellow chipmaker LLTC, Freescale cites weak industrial and telecom demand as reasons for its soft guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • OSK

    Shares of Oshkosh (NYSE:OSK) and Navistar (NYSE:NAV) react gleefully to a report Carl Icahn...

    Shares of Oshkosh (NYSE:OSK) and Navistar (NYSE:NAV) react gleefully to a report Carl Icahn would like to marry the two companies. More sources have now piled in, with one suggesting Icahn will push for one or more seats on Navistar's board. OSK +7.2%, NAV +4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • AIXXF

    Aixtron (AIXG -3.6%) trades lower after Kaufman cuts the shares to Hold, citing increased...

    Aixtron (AIXG -3.6%) trades lower after Kaufman cuts the shares to Hold, citing increased competition and lower demand coming out of China.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • BAC

    U.S. bank stocks (XLF +2%) surge in early trading, responding to rising sentiment that Europe is...

    U.S. bank stocks (XLF +2%) surge in early trading, responding to rising sentiment that Europe is moving forward with talks. Among financials in the Dow: BAC +2.3%, JPM +1.9%, AXP +2.9%, TRV +2.6%. Also: AIG +3.4%, MET +2.9%, MS +2.5%. A noticeable outlier is SunTrust (STI -5.3%), the S&P's worst performer following its earnings release.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • CKH

    Seacor (NYSE:CKH) trades lower, down 5.9%, after Q3 profits and revenue sank Y/Y off of a tough...

    Seacor (NYSE:CKH) trades lower, down 5.9%, after Q3 profits and revenue sank Y/Y off of a tough comparable from last year's business level spike from the Gulf oil spill cleanup. "A soft market for offshore marine equipment in the US Gulf of Mexico continued to negatively impact results," states the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT -17%), which crashed 2 weeks ago after its Q3 warning, does it again after...

    Acme Packet (APKT -17%), which crashed 2 weeks ago after its Q3 warning, does it again after posting Q3 results featuring a slight revenue miss. Skepticism appears to remain regarding the firm's 2011 guidance (unchanged since July), and CC remarks about customers still finalizing their 2012 plans could be adding to investor fears.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • GNC

    Health store chain GNC gains 6.3% after recording a Q3 earnings and revenue beat, reporting EPS...

    Health store chain GNC gains 6.3% after recording a Q3 earnings and revenue beat, reporting EPS of $0.46 vs. $0.36 consensus on revenue of $538M (+16% Y/Y). The company updates its revenue guidance, now seeing a 12.5% gain in sales for 2011 - compared to prior guidance in a range of 9%-10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM

  • The pummeling of the dollar may be the most important news of the day, which sniffs of...

    The pummeling of the dollar may be the most important news of the day, which sniffs of additional Fed QE rather than Europe having solved its issues. A speech last night from the Fed's Daniel Tarullo arguing for additional MBS purchases looks to be the catalyst.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • WDC

    Sandisk (SNDK +6.6%) surges in early trading, as investors focus more on the healthy margins...

    Sandisk (SNDK +6.6%) surges in early trading, as investors focus more on the healthy margins demonstrated by its EPS beat, than on the company's slight revenue miss. Sandisk used its CC to guide for Q4 revenue of $1.5B-$1.6B ($1.68B consensus), and to note mobile device-related sales remain strong, with revenue increasing 25% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • JBL

    Shares of Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL) bounce 2.5% higher on the open after the firm announces a...

    Shares of Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL) bounce 2.5% higher on the open after the firm announces a $100M stock repurchasement program.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • MNI

    Struggling newspaper owner McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI) gains 12.9% premarket after reporting Q3...

    Struggling newspaper owner McClatchy (NYSEMKT:MNI) gains 12.9% premarket after reporting Q3 revenue of $300.4M (-8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.14; the former missed by $7.2M, thanks to a 10% Y/Y decline in ad revenue and a 4.3% decline in daily circulation, but the latter beat by $0.07, thanks to debt and expense reduction efforts. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • STX

    Shares of Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) shoot up 13.1% premarket after landing an upgrade to...

    Shares of Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) shoot up 13.1% premarket after landing an upgrade to Buy from Hold from ThinkEquity, and rolling up more momentum off the heels of Western Digital's (NYSE:WDC) Thai-related production slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • LYB

    Dutch chemical maker LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) is up 11.4% premarket after Bloomberg reports the...

    Dutch chemical maker LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) is up 11.4% premarket after Bloomberg reports the company, which has a market cap of $15.7B, might pay a $2.6B special dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM

  • A curious occurrence as risk moves very much on this morning, but the greenback has plummeted...

    A curious occurrence as risk moves very much on this morning, but the greenback has plummeted against the yen over the past few minutes, diving to ¥75.93, essentially a post-WWII low.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • STX

    Premarket gainers: STX +14%. SYNA +12%. LYB +11%. GNC +8%. YRCW +7%. SNDK +5%. GMCR +5%. HON...

    Premarket gainers: STX +14%. SYNA +12%. LYB +11%. GNC +8%. YRCW +7%. SNDK +5%. GMCR +5%. HON +4%. AKS +4%. TSL +4%. RIO +4%. FCX +3%. ALTR +3%. MCD +3%.
    Losers: MTG -13%. RDN -6%. APKT -4%. REDF -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • MCD

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) Q3: 8% Y/Y revenue growth exc. currency effects. Global comparable...

    More on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) Q3: 8% Y/Y revenue growth exc. currency effects. Global comparable sales +5% Y/Y; U.S. +4.4%, Europe +4.9%, Asia/Africa +3.4%. Company sees October comparable sales up 4%-5% Y/Y. Strong U.S. performance partly attributed to new McCafe and breakfast products. MCD +2.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    More on Green Mountain: Chappell addresses the accounting fraud issue, saying it stems from a 6...

    More on Green Mountain: Chappell addresses the accounting fraud issue, saying it stems from a 6 month old shareholder lawsuit relating to sales from 2 years ago, and that GMCR has already restated its results for 2008-2010. As bullish as ever on the shares, Chappell makes the stock his top pick.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • INTC

    In a sign chip stocks may have priced in weak results, Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) is up 1.9% premarket...

    In a sign chip stocks may have priced in weak results, Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) is up 1.9% premarket in spite of missing Q3 forecasts, even after a September warning, and guiding Q4 revenue to decline 7%-11% Q/Q. During its CC, CEO John Daane said Altera believes customers are "sharply reducing inventory below normal levels, in anticipation of a slowdown."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) is ripping higher as SunTrust's Bill Chappell goes postal on...

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) is ripping higher as SunTrust's Bill Chappell goes postal on David Einhorn's short thesis. Chappell knows a bit about the information Einhorn used, seeing as his firm prepared the reports. Among other things, he claims Einhorn made a math error by double-counting packaging costs. Shares +4.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 3 Comments
  • BIIB

    The FDA extends its review date for the MS drug Tysabri - produced by Biogen Idec (NASDAQ:BIIB)...

    The FDA extends its review date for the MS drug Tysabri - produced by Biogen Idec (NASDAQ:BIIB) and Elan (NYSE:ELN) - indicating it needs the extension to review changes in the risk evaluation and mitigation strategies for the drug. Premarket: BIIB -6%, ELN inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q3 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.17B (+13.7% Y/Y) beats by...

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD): Q3 EPS of $1.45 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $7.17B (+13.7% Y/Y) beats by $160M. Shares +2.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • INFA

    Data warehousing software firm Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) is down 6.2% premarket following its Q3...

    Data warehousing software firm Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) is down 6.2% premarket following its Q3 report. Though EPS beat by $.02, revenue was barely above consensus. In addition, Informatica, which sports a trailing P/E of 44, guided on its CC for Q4 revenue of $218M-$228M, below a consensus off $228.2M.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
